Name: Hart, Miss. Eva Miriam
Remarks: one of the last survivors, many television appearances? Talked to James Cameron about her experiences

Name: Ridsdale, Miss. Lucy
Remarks: accounts from her cabin mate Mary Davis say she was already in boat 14. she assisted Lucy, because Lucy was suffering from a club foot. They both got into 14 then. the boat also leaked after its launch (fell a few feet) which fits Lucs description

Name: Bowker, Miss. Ruth Harwood
Profession: boat 6 is unlikely, as it had more 1st class passengers or deck crew and lowered with very few (probably not more than 25). Elvina and Bowker Ruth Harwood escaped together. boat 12 or 14 seem more likely as it had more staff on board and left later. when in doubt, pick 14 as the more likely boat as it had more staff and left even later and had more passengers on board.

Name: Martin, Miss. Mabel Elvina
Profession: boat 6 is unlikely, as it had more 1st class passengers or deck crew and lowered with very few (probably not more than 25). Elvina and Bowker Ruth Harwood escaped together. boat 12 or 14 seem more likely as it had more staff on board and left later. when in doubt, pick 14 as the more likely boat as it had more staff and left even later and had more passengers on board.

Name: Heikkinen, Miss. Laina
Profession: She was most likely transferred to boat 10 because she can remember that she stayed in the boat for about 6 hours before help arrived.
Death: apparently waited for 6 hours until Carpathia rescue

Name: Sjöblom, Miss. Anna Sofia
Profession: got into lifeboat 14 as there are no 3rd class passengers recorded on boat 12 yet. could have been transferred to boat 12 though!

Name: Nasser, Mrs. Adele / Adāl Naṣr Allāh
Profession: most likely rescued in 14 and then transferred to 12 or was rescued in 13 because 2nd class and woman fits lots of survivors on that boat

Name: Yazbeck, Mrs. Selini
Remarks: same boat as her nephews Mubārik, Master. Halīm and Mubārik, Mrs. Amīnah. her account states she was later transferred, there were about 20 women and 5 crewmen on board.

Name: Tannūs, Mrs. Thamīn
Lifeboat: Transfer from A to 14 to D
Profession: Boat C and D are likely, but Boat D left closer to boat 16. many accounts speak for her baby As'ad to have left with boat 16. she must have followed close afterwards.

Name: Marvin, Mrs. Mary Graham Carmichael
Profession: initially in boat 14 then transferred to 10

Name: Lang, Mr. Fang
Lifeboat Transfer?: plunged into sea and was picked from the water as boat 14 returned.

Name: Williams, Mr. Charles Eugene
Profession: remained in the boat as it returned to help row

Name: Scarrott, Mr. Joseph George
Profession: took charge of the boat as one of the only sailors / deck crew. later joined by two from boat 10 to help.

Name: Anderson, Mr. James
Profession: no info, but as he was crew he most likely ended up in boat 14 as the crew boat.

Name: Harris, Mr. Frederick
Remarks: jumped into the water onto a small wooden object before picked up by boat 14

Name: Phillimore, Mr. Harold Charles William
Remarks: climbed into 14 from a raft/ wooden object in the water

Name: Yūsuf, Michael Peter
Profession: baby of the Yūsuf Family, which got on boat C. his mother lost him before getting onto a lifeboat. he could have been put on boat 14, which was near boat C or returned to pick up some more people. it also had a lot of kids on board as well.

Name: Jansson, Mr. Carl Olof
Profession: jumped into the water to boat A, which then nearly sank and then was transferred to boat 14
Death: He remained onboard, staying with August Wennerström until the ship's final throes before jumping and swimming to waterlogged collapsible A. He later admitted pushing others away from the frail craft in "a tough fight in the water" to prevent it going down due to excess weight.
